result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn D Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of Out-of-State Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. 
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds.  Remaining balance to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid portion to convert to a civil judgment.
with credit for 138 days time served.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn D Jackson

records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, for review. jbs
Original PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (21 pages) commencing MAY 12, 2016, received and filed.  jm

Statements made as to sentencing.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS, with credit for 138 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR AND 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. 
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds.  Remaining balance to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid portion to convert to a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Shawn D Jackson in court with attorney Robert Buckett.  Defendant Shawn D Jackson in custody.  Randall L Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instruction received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor.  Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  

Diluted test.  Parties instructed to report to Branch 22 immediately for bail review.

Attorney Robert Buckett in court, defendant Shawn D Jackson not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman for Randall L Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is in resolution posture.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert Buckett in court, defendant Shawn D Jackson not in court, in custody.  Randall L Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel was recently appointed and requests status date to allow time to review discovery.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shawn D Jackson in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Shawn D Jackson in custody.  Randall L Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for plea hearing today.  Defense counsel's motion to withdraw argued and GRANTED by the Court forthwith.  Counsel to notify OPD immediately.  Status conference scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Shawn D Jackson not in court, in custody.  Randall L Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for plea and sentencing hearing today.  Court is in trial and unable to conduct hearing.  Matter may still resolve, matter is adjourned for PLEA only.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Shawn D Jackson not in court, in custody.  Randall L Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is set for scheduling conference, counsel requests to argue bail.  Hearing held.  Defense motion to reduce bail argued and DENIED by the Court.  Counsel requests plea date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Shawn D Jackson in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Shawn D Jackson in custody.  Randall L Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Shawn D Jackson in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Shawn D Jackson in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
